ETYMOLOGY: From Old French tronc, from Latin truncus 'trunk of a tree or body'.
SINCE: Late 14th century (for tree/body); mid-17th century (for chest); early 19th century (for elephant's proboscis); early 20th century (for car compartment).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The main woody stem of a tree, from which branches grow.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 树的主干，从其上生出枝条。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The squirrel ran up the trunk of the oak tree.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 松鼠沿着橡树的树干爬了上去。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The long, flexible nose of an elephant.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The elephant used its trunk to spray water on itself.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 大象用它的鼻子向自己喷水。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A large, strong box or case, typically made of wood or metal, used for storing or transporting clothes and other personal belongings.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一个大而结实的箱子或盒子，通常由木头或金属制成，用于存放或运输衣物和其他个人物品。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She packed her old photographs into a large trunk in the attic.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她把旧照片打包放在阁楼里一个大箱子里。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The enclosed storage space in the back of a car.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 汽车后部封闭的储物空间。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Please put the groceries in the trunk.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 请把杂货放进汽车后备箱。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The main part of a human or animal body, excluding the head and limbs; the torso.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 人或动物身体的主要部分，不包括头部和四肢；躯干。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The wrestler had a powerful trunk and thick limbs.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位摔跤手有着强壮的躯干和粗壮的四肢。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these. Often used in plural form.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Short trousers worn by men for swimming.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He forgot his swim trunks and had to buy a new pair.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他忘记带泳裤了，只好买了一条新的。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adjective: A word or phrase naming an attribute, added to or grammatically related to a noun to modify or describe it.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Constituting a main route or channel for communication, transportation, or data.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 构成通信、交通或数据传输的主干线路或通道的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The new trunk road will ease traffic congestion in the city center.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 新的干线公路将缓解市中心的交通拥堵。

REGISTER: Generally standard and common across most contexts.
